website_summaries.verdict: If you've bemoaned the loss of DVD burners, HDMI outputs and Ethernet jacks or you miss being able to easily add RAM and a hard drive on your own, the Acer Aspire E 15 is what you want. Its solid performance and battery life make it an even sweeter deal.
pros: The Acer Aspire E 15 (E5-576G-5762) is a wonderful mix of fresh components, simple design and handy features that have disappeared from most other laptops
Battery life and performance are great for its class
cons: Its size and weight are a bit much if you need a laptop you can regularly use on the go

customer_reviews.title: Can this game???
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop, I got it for gaming and it does that exactly!!! From my experience this laptop can go to 100 fps on LoL with highest settings 40--60 FPS on skyrim Ultra settings 70+ FPS on rocket league highest settings 60+ fps on CSGO highest settings 60+ FPS on Fornite Medium settings This is a REALLY good budget gaming laptop, highly recommend Doesn't heat up that bad at all, can get a bit hot with the newest games, so far haven't found a flaw to it
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn R. Rehkopf

customer_reviews.title: Became unresponsive after less than three months, Acer won't do anything about it.
customer_reviews.text: The computer worked flawlessly up until it randomly shut off one day and became unresponsive. I've owned it for a little over two and a half months so naturally I was upset. When I sent it back to Acer to repair it they simply claimed it had water damaging and couldn't fix it. Instead they offered to sell my a replacement for the same cost of the original. I'm very careful and very strict about keeping liquids away from my electronic devices. I'm very upset with how the company has dealt with this issue. I will not be buying an Acer again.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Abrego

customer_reviews.title: My screen now has numerous horizontal and vertical white bands ...
customer_reviews.text: My screen now has numerous horizontal and vertical white bands making it impossible to use the laptop. Acer refused to pay for shipping it back to them for warranty repairs. California law mandates that products shipped to California customers must have free shipping for warranty repairs over-riding whatever the manufacturer puts in their warranty agreements. After spending over 30 min on the phone with their supervisors, Acer finally agreed to pay for shipping as "one-time courtesy" even though it was their obligation under the California law. Hope your states have a similar law on the books protecting you from such scavengers.
customer_reviews.author: Seaman

customer_reviews.title: Monitor went out after 1 month.
customer_reviews.text: Monitor went out 35 days after receiving. Dropped my son off at college 8 hours away. Didn't take box laptop was shipped in as it's a new product right?, opted for Amazon Basic protector case. What a mistake. 5 days too late for Amazon Warranty, 2 months too early for Square Trade Warranty, Acer will take a look if you send it back on your dime. Great freakin' great. Small college town, son having problems getting packed correctly for insurance. What a hassle... Out $700. plus probably another $40. for return shipping. Meanwhile my son has no laptop for his summer classes.
customer_reviews.author: RoryG

customer_reviews.title: Just got it today. Powered it on and did ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today. Powered it on and did all the updates. Powered it down and back up a few time to check boot times and now ibhave huge black lines running down the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Battery Problems
customer_reviews.text: My Acer Aspire e 15 worked great for a day, and then shut off by itself. Called tech support and they had me reset the computer by pushing paper clip in pinhole in back of computer...That seemed to correct problem, but problem returned next day and the battery would only charge up to 1% with charger plugged in . I had to keep charger plugged in to use a new computer...Acer I think you have a track record with battery problems with this computer.. Please note I contacted Amazon for a refund and I returned the defective computer for a quick refund---thank you Amazon.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: purchased this new and with high expectations. We have ...
customer_reviews.text: purchased this new and with high expectations. We have been using it for about a month. While the computer starts up and runs quickly we are experiencing frequent crashes. While browsing or completing basic tasks the screen goes black and the only solution is to hold the power button down until it turns off. The is very frustrating and disappointing! I have only installed Microsoft office and the driver for my printer so this should not be happening after 1 month!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Peters

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Display driver fails 3X a day. Loses Wifi connection every hour. Sometimes won't boot. I bought two of them, installed all BIOS and driver updates. They are simply unreliable, poorly made laptops.
customer_reviews.author: LoudZenGuy

customer_reviews.title: 4 months later it won't turn on
customer_reviews.text: Bought this laptop in May 2018. Then in September it stopped turning on. Eventually got it to start again then it happened again. Amazon said go through Acer for warranty support. Sent laptop to Acer. Acer allegedly replaced circuit board and shipped back to me. Laptop still experiencing same issue. Sent to Acer a 2nd time. Waiting their "fix". Amazon says they can't intervene until Acer has at least tried everything on their end to correct the issue. Hasn't worked so far. Besides that, when the laptop did work it worked very well. I like the specs and how it runs but it's useless if it doesn't turn on.
customer_reviews.author: ohyeah24

customer_reviews.title: Quit after less than six months
customer_reviews.text: Computer has great specs (reviewed elsewhere) and when it worked, was great. Pretty snappy, lots of storage, had everything I needed. Bought in September 2018, battery stopped charging in February 2019. Battery and connections all fine but no more charging. So, basically a $600 brick. The stars for material quality, sound quality and battery life are based on when the computer was working. I gave it one star overall for dying this fast. I agree with the positive reviews given by others but (after my Acer died) I have also seen several places online where the problem with the battery not charging is talked about.
customer_reviews.author: Che

customer_reviews.title: SSD crashed a few months in.  Data loss, lack of quality.
customer_reviews.text: Laptop was purchased as a new computer for my mother so she would have a better machine. Additionally, being new, it would require me to perform LESS "IT Support". Registry errors occurred after just a few months and the SSD had to be wiped and everything reinstalled. I have had to provide more IT support than I did with her Toshiba laptop circa 2012. I would have to describe their quality control as lax. I will admit that the customer support which I accessed through my phone was very good. Update: Laptop was purchased in Feb of 2018. It is now completely dead and will not restart. Acer should refund everything but I doubt they will.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing (not) experience
customer_reviews.text: The speaker didn't work first. Fix it with the warranty in a couple of weeks. When I got it back I realize I DOESN'T WORK WITHOUT BEING PLUGGED TO THE POWER CORD! The battery is dead and the laptop was brand new. Immediately requested a refund. What an amazing (not) experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Lugo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing laptop, but please update Acer graphics driver.
customer_reviews.text: So far, its everything I wanted in a laptop. Sure, a bit of a lighter laptop would be cool, but its difficult to find a SSD with quad cores and a sweet GPU. This laptop starts up instantly and has lightning fast download capabilities. I've only had it for a few days, but it puts my old laptop to shame. Backlit keyboard as well. Most important thing to know: Install the latest graphics driver from Acer, as you won't be able to change brightness settings or put the computer to sleep until then. Resolution will improve slightly as well.
customer_reviews.author: Darvon

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is awful
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a couple days then stopped holding a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: In about 8 months of ownership, the power charger died (was warrantied) and now the upper portion of the screen has become dim. Acer will not warranty the screen because they consider it 'physical damage.' It went dim while I was using it in bed, the laptop never leaves the house, and has never been dropped or hit. Another issue is that 1/3rd of the time the laptop will not wake from sleep. This has been going on since around the 2 month mark. The keyboard will light up, but only a hard reset will start the computer. If this laptop was in a more rigid case, it may be worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan S

customer_reviews.title: Has a lot of problems
customer_reviews.text: My son was so excited to get his laptop. The first one the a key was broken. The second one the volume stopped working. I’m not trying a third one.
customer_reviews.author: Akelia Thompson

customer_reviews.title: piece of junk, poor support, buy a dell or an hp - broken now for two months of owning it
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS LAPTOP! ACER WILL NOT STAND BY THEIR PRODUCT...IT WAS SENT BACK AFTER A MONTH DUE TO THE SCREEN NOT COMING ON. THEY HAD THE UNIT FOR TWO WEEKS AND I JUST OPENED IT TO FIND THAT IT WAS NOT FIXED AND IS EXPERIENCING THE EXACT SAME PROBLEM OF NO SCREEN. THEY SAY WARRANTY WILL NOT PROVIDE REPLACEMENT OF THE UNIT AND I NEED TO SEND IT BACK. SO, IN THE TWO MONTHS OF OWNING, IT HAS YET TO WORK RELIABLY. BUY A DELL OR AN HP!
customer_reviews.author: Garrett M.

customer_reviews.title: Graphics/display problem
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a couple months, and used it only occasionally. Eventually the graphics card died or something. No display. Even when connecting to an external monitor, no display. Had to return. Amazon was good about it.
customer_reviews.author: JN901

customer_reviews.title: Great System for a Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: This is what I was looking for a in a budget Gaming PC. I am able to play Most AAA titles such as Overwatch, Fortnite, Rainbow Six Siege at Medium to Low Settings at 1080P (Medium to High at 720P). It works well with what I need it for in CAD and other software's that I use for my engineering classes. I would totally recommend this product to any one looking to squeeze the most out of their hardware with this system.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Tapley

customer_reviews.title: Computer works fine, however
customer_reviews.text: Computer works fine, however, I was under the impression this laptop came with DDR4 RAM. I did a lot of research on which laptop to buy and am positive when I bought it it said DDR4. After recently opening it up to see for myself, I realized it is DDR3.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Whited

customer_reviews.title: Acer support is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: The computer showed up as advertised. The problem that I have is that it shipped with a BIOS password that has not been provided. I contacted Acer support, and they want me to ship it to them and charge $100 to take off the BIOS password since this work is not covered by a warranty. This is terrible customer support, and I recommend that nobody purchase from Acer ever.
customer_reviews.author: kyleja

customer_reviews.title: nice laptop
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my previous laptop and this one was a close match. Although it feels less sturdy as my old Toshiba, it has the backlit keyboard and 15.6 inch screen I liked. The HD screen and fast SSD hard drive is so much better than what I was accustomed. The sound is OK and I love the long battery life.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Graphics are fine while the computer works and the backlit keyboard was ...
customer_reviews.text: Graphics are fine while the computer works and the backlit keyboard was great. I've purchased 4 Acer or Asus laptops from Amazon and they have all been DOA. With the latest one the battery wouldn't retain a charge and the computer would not run unless it was plugged into the wall. I sent it to the Acer repair facility where they swapped out the battery but were not very thorough in diagnosing the problem because the laptop was shipped back to me and had the same issues. I probably won't ever buy an Acer or an Asus again.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Trout

customer_reviews.title: Totally Crashed and Failed After 2 Months
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months this computer has totally crashed. And they will not replace the laptop. Acre says that there is nothing they can do. Online support from India wants to reload the operating system. We have only used this for email and light internet surfing. This is terrible and I would like to return it but the return window closed after 1 month. We bought this due to the good reviews. Please consider this alternate view.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The sound card stopped working on the first Acer computer I received. nothing my computer guy did corrected the absence of sound. Oh, it worked fine for about 3 weeks and then the sound would only work if i had ear buds or a headset plugged in. I called Amazon and they sent out a new computer that day. Funny thing is as I was transferring files from first computer to the replacement, the sound started working. But I sent the computer back after getting all my files transferred. Must be a short in the sound card. Replacement computer - I love! Thanks, Amazon
customer_reviews.author: L. Crum

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This computer does everything I need it to do. Worth every penny. Incredible screen!!! (Clear view from any angle), backlit keyboard (that isn't red), slim and easy to carry around. The SSD card starts this laptop up in >5secs. My need for this laptop is simple web browsing, watching videos/netflix (Easy 1080p), and light gaming. So far it has performed great. No issues. If you are into hardcore gaming or video editting, I would recommend looking for something different. For all other cases, this is the laptop you want to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sjv

customer_reviews.title: I want to purchase another one because it seemed like it would be a great machine if it did ...
customer_reviews.text: DOA... Plugged in the unit and it would not boot up. No sign of life except for the orange LED showing the unit had power coming in. Amazon handled the return well. Had to make a couple of phone calls but all-in-all the response was reasonable and refund received. I want to purchase another one because it seemed like it would be a great machine if it did power up and it has the configuration/features I like.
customer_reviews.author: DKS

customer_reviews.title: flimsy
customer_reviews.text: As a 7 year old man with poor eyesight I regret purchasing this laptop' Aside from the fact that updating windowschas been an impossible to navigate the first thing I noticed when I pick up the laptop my hand ends up right on the dvd slot which is extremely flimsy and subject to breakage. The speakers are located on the bottom of the laptop?????? The keys are all spongy, like they will break in no time.. My old laptop with Windows XP is a much more solid build and after 16 years of hassle free operation will outlast this junky laptop which might last a year or less before repairs
customer_reviews.author: roderick fraser

customer_reviews.title: Cant even use the Screen now.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this computer not too long back and it had the problem of the screen not wanting to turn on when the computer was turned on but I didnt know the problem would get this bad. I havent even had this computer for a year yet and the screen wont turn on at all. It seems to just be a display problem but now Im going to have to waste money to get it fixed. Other than that, everything else with it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: claudette suarez

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, GOOD Battery life, dGPU, Expandable Storage+RAM, Best I/O hands down.
customer_reviews.text: If you want good battery life, moderately-priced, dGPU (that you can turn off!), that COMES with an SSD, expandable memory and storage AND has USB-C, a CD/DVD drive, a VGA output, a Kensington lock, 3 USB ports, an ethernet port, a headphone jack, and an HDMI output, then this is the perfect laptop for you! Oh, and it comes with 802.11 ac wireless, a 1080p display, AND an SD card slot! Also, you can buy replacement batteries for this laptop very cheaply! For Acer sales team: The only improvement I'd recommend for this would be to make a 4000 mAh battery for this, even if it costs the CD/DVD drive.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Review from a casual user
customer_reviews.text: I got this laptop for netflix, email/surfing and some gaming. I can say that the graphics are pretty good, but the battery doesn't last 12 hours as the description claims. I get about 5 hours out of it when just surfing, etc. If I watch netflix I get about 3 hours and if I play Civilization VI It'll run for an hour. The keyboard is backlit...but only while typing. A few seconds after you stop, the keyboard goes dark. It plays most of the games I like from Steam, but I have to plug in the power cord.
customer_reviews.author: Tasty Niblet

customer_reviews.title: Acer Aspire E 15 excellent desktop replacement
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice laptop! Very fast with 2.59 gb SSD hard drive to store programs. I easily added a WD Blue 3D NAND 1TB PC SSD - SATA III 6 Gb/s 2.5"/7mm Solid State Drive - WDS100T2B0A to store files . Beautiful high-resolution display. Both Adobe Photoshop and Corel Painter open fast on this computer. The 5.27 lb weight is a little too heavy for me to carry around but may be easier for a younger person. I am not a fan of Win10 but hopefully will adapt to it. This laptop is a good replacement for a desktop. I bought it when my desktop was in the shop for about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Granny B

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I am no super techie so someone who is expecting more from a laptop might have a different opinion. I use this for school and home use and it is very smooth running, loads quickly and the size has a nice feel. Very easy set up. I had been using it unplugged off and on for 4 days and last night was the first warning I received for low battery, so I thought that was impressive. I had one incident where it would not turn back on, I believe it was operator error, because I just closed it and came back to it the next day and it turned on just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Christina B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome laptop!
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop! I have the Intel Core i7. Soooo fast! Comfortable keyboard! Nice features! Love the Cortana! First time user for Windows 10 and it's pretty good. I loved Windows 7 and miss it a little - but I got used to Windows 10 and has nice features that Windows 7 didn't have. Was fast enough with 8gb but I added another 8gb so now have 16gb total. Was very easy to add memory. I purchased on Amazon the additional memory - here is the correct one for this laptop: Crucial 8GB Single DDR3/DDR3L 1600 MT/S (PC3-12800) Unbuffered SODIMM 204-Pin Memory - CT102464BF160B
customer_reviews.author: R. Lipschutz

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed a fan playing Civilization V of all things
customer_reviews.text: Nice laptop at first. Tried to play Civ V on it (should've been easy for it to handle) and it got a little hot, despite being on a tray. Fan started making crazy noises, so I turned it off and left it in a cool area for the rest of the day. Booted it up the next day and the fan was burned out. This laptop literally lost its fan playing CIV V. Maybe I have a defective unit but I'm not the only person this has happened to!
customer_reviews.author: AmzCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Worst laptop I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: As I surveyed the laptops with positive reviews, I decided to buy this one because it had the most positive reviews. The price seemed to be good as well. However, as it came to me, there were tons of problems. Although it starts very quickly, but the power of this laptop is very weak! You cannot run a few files simultaneously. As you do it, the fan runs angrily and it becomes very hot. The noise that the fan makes immediately elicit your doubt regarding its power force. One opened Microsoft Excel file is enough to make it die. Second, black screen. Very frequently, it does not wake up from sleep. You have to restart it. Very sad!
customer_reviews.author: Wang

customer_reviews.title: I mailed this back to Acer Repair Center because the ...
customer_reviews.text: I mailed this back to Acer Repair Center because the screen cracked without any undue force applied to it. When they received it they sent out an email which went to my junk mail that it was not covered by the warranty, but that they could charge for the repair. But because we didn't see the email until several days later, it was already on it way back without the repair. Thanks, Acer.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E Monson

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After 3 Weeks!
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this Acer as it would not boot up after having it for only 3 weeks. Screen completely black. Also, Windows 10 is a nightmare. Ten companies fighting for your attention when you go online. Windows XP worked perfectly! Will save up and buy a Macbook Air. At least it will turn on. Would never buy an Acer, seemed cheap right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Wise One

customer_reviews.title: Acer saved money in the right parts
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely incredible bang for the buck. I really like this computer, and I also own a fully loaded macbook pro 15 inch (2016). Here's the bottom line: It's not a perfect computer. But I believe that Acer got it right on the place to save some money. It has a good screen, input methods (though I would really appreciate a glass trackpad), good IO, nice battery and excellent internals. Just great for the price! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Light
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a friend of mine, who is not really computer literate! She uses it mainly as a vehicle for Facebook, and buying and selling items on Amazon, Facebook, QVC, Soft Face Place, etc! It doesn't have a touch screen and she doesn't play games that require high intensity graphics or super fast computing abilities! It is light for easy traveling and has a very nice screen that is easy to read, right out of the box! Overall she is very happy and that makes me happy!
customer_reviews.author: Talisynn

customer_reviews.title: Power Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This laptop isn’t going to win any awards for design and it’s not the fastest processor or best display, but for the money it was the best I could find after weeks of research. I use it mainly for writing and research but it can run modern games at decent resolutions and run multiple programs without issues. If you have a budget and need a workhorse, this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Alex D Henderson

customer_reviews.title: My 2¢
customer_reviews.text: For the price I don't know if it's possible to get more out of a new in box laptop. Now I'm not a super big tech guy but I did all the research I could before I bought this and I consulted my father (who is a Senior IT manager) about a lot of it and I found that the features of this laptop and the modularity of it make this an incredibly versitilie investment.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great Gaming Computer for Beginner
customer_reviews.text: With the help of a work colleague who is knowledgeable about gaming computers and some online tutorials, I purchased this computer for my 12 year old daughter who is into gaming and digital art. She has been very happy with the computer and it works great for the games she plays and her digital art. It was in my budget, which was the most important aspect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli H.

customer_reviews.title: Hard Drive failure in 5 months of purchase. They don't make them like they used to
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive failed in 5 months of purchase. I lost everything. Fortunately, Acer support covered it under manufacture warranty. The replacement will take between 3-8 business days to ship to me. The product support guy was extremely helpful, so my compliments to him.
customer_reviews.author: EconomicsWin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value and performance
customer_reviews.text: As far as value goes, this Acer is extremely hard to beat. I debated for a while between this and some of the fancier “coffee shop” laptops and I’m really happy with this purchase. It may not be as flashy but the hardware and performance back this bad boy up. So glad I saved several hundred dollars and still am getting a great experience. My only “complaint” is that the material used on the device (i.e. dressed up plastic) is a fingerprint magnet so I constently find myself wiping the laptop down as fingerprint smudges drive me crazy! Other than that small nitpick, I am completely satisfied. If you’re on the fence, go for it, you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to get the Acer E 15 laptop up and running.  Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Windows 10, Intel 8th gen i5 chip and 8 GB RAM makes for a fast laptop. I went with 256 GB SSD. Has 4 ports with 1920x1080 resolution, Nvidia Ge Force MX150 graphics card. Lit keyboard a pleasure to use with a comfortable touch. Hooks up to bluetooth equipment very quickly. Perfect size. Technical support excellent. I needed help to get DVD player to work. Dan at Amazon tech support very patiently helped me install VLC Media Player which is exactly what my computer needed to play DVDs. Great computer. The specs in this laptop are exactly what I was looking for. Would highly recommend Acer Aspire E 15 laptop with the above specs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GPU & CPU
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is OVER underestimated. VERY Fast, upgradeable SSD & RAM, GREAT GPU & CPU. I played GTA 5, Sniper Elite 3, CSGO & VRCHAT on it and it runs smooth and beautiful on medium quality. This is running with the laptop's monitor. It does get a little slower with my 4k Monitor and I tried on my 1920x1080p monitor and it improve a little bit but I prefer using the laptop's monitor. Another thing is the keyboard. I am in love with the feeling of it. Everything about this laptop is amazing for the price. I can type super fast using the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Matheus

customer_reviews.title: Works ok for my needs, hinge broke.
customer_reviews.text: This has been an ok computer for my needs. Not very good quality a year and a half after purchase the hinge has broken. It was stiff to begin with. The power plug in would makes sizzling noises if it was moved around. The screen will not wake up from sleep mode sometimes requiring a hard reboot. I also had to make the computer go to sleep every time the lid was closed so the screen would wake up when I opened it again. It had started to not wake up every time I opened the lid, requiring a reboot. Would not buy another Acer.
customer_reviews.author: He110

customer_reviews.title: Out of box: wireless won't connect
customer_reviews.text: I live in an apartment where there are at least a dozen wifi networks within range. I have gigabit fiber at home. Out of the box, the wireless adapter would only pick up one of the dozen networks in vicinity. This was not even my 5G network but my slower 2.4. And it picked it up so weakly that it would never connect. I spent an hour with Acer support trying to troubleshoot. No luck, so I'm sending it back. I'll update when I get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful Diver

customer_reviews.title: A lot of bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this laptop for about 4 months now. It runs way faster than my old desktop used to. The screen looks great (though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution) and the keyboard response feels pretty good. The battery life is not quite as long as advertised, but I can get through daily life just fine without lugging my charger everywhere. Really the only problem I have is the lack of storage space, but modern computers have many ways around that (cloud storage, external hard drives, etc). It's a lot of good for a comparatively cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Quit working in 6 days
customer_reviews.text: The computer has quit working in six days. It acted up once three days ago but came back on. The screen seems to come and go. The charger is in and beeps when taken out. Starts off with two blue lights but goes to one orange and one blue. I have left it on charge for five hours and the screen want come on. Also I can't cut the computer off even holding the button for several minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Russell

customer_reviews.title: ""UPDATE""  (amazon is awesome)monitor stopped working after three weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: ''UPDATE" Amazon just sent me a brand new one, and I'm returning the broken one...even though it was four days past the return window they helped me out. In a couple of days I'll have a brand new laptop. Amazon is awesome I liked the laptop right up until it stopped working. I went online to see if it was a simple fix and found that apparently this is not an uncommon problem with these laptops. Called Acer and went through some troubleshooting with them, but ended up having to ship it back to them. So two weeks without my laptop. Not really happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Computer worked great for a little over a year. Then one day it wouldn't power up. I took it in for repairs they told me it was a fried cpu. On Acer laptops the flu is welded to the motherboard. This would be a very expensive repair. The repairman informed me it wouldn't be worth repairing as this is a comen problem with this model. If I got it repaired it would probably break down again. After reading other reviews of this laptop mine lasted longer than most. Some arrived doa or died after about 3 months. I would recommend staying far away from this computer. After a year I am the proud owner of a $600 brick!
customer_reviews.author: I.M. Janky

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it less than a year ago and I have had to return it twice. The first time was within 30 days, so I could return it thru Amazon. The second time was 3 weeks ago. Acer told me they would have it back to me in 7-10 days and that was 3 weeks ago. When the laptop worked, it was fine, but it is very unreliable. I would buy a Dell or an HP if I could go back in time. Dont waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: bldeath81

customer_reviews.title: Solid machine, great value!
customer_reviews.text: A good value. Build quality is quite decent. With the SSD option, 8 gigs+ of RAM, the i5 processor and pretty powerful MX150 graphics card everything has run very smoothly. Backlit keyboard and crisp 1080 display are very nice features that make it feel like a more premium model. Downsides: This thing is big and heavy! Many won't need the DVD-R drive, pretty basic look, nothing fancy but that does t bother me. Overall very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: only downside is that the mouse buttens arent seperated like old acer mouses so if you have your finger ...
customer_reviews.text: having researched almost every single laptop in its range, this one surely meets all the expectation from size to quality and performance when compared to its price, only downside is that the mouse buttons arent separated like old acer mouses so if you have your finger on the click and an other swiping on the pad it would take it as 2 touches
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Love this Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I normally buy cheaper laptops, but splurged for this one. I love the Solid State drive, as reviews or ads say you can boot up and get onto internet in 10 to 15 seconds. As I said I have older laptops but I can boot up games I play in seconds instead of minutes now.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Primmer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a do-everything machine.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of value for the price. The battery is amazing, screen resolution top notch, speed is pretty good, and keys are easy to press. The backlit keyboard is a wonderful feature that I wasn't looking for but love. The only thing I really think could be an issue is the brightness of the screen. I've only used it indoors and it's perfect for that, but I'm at 85% brightness. I doubt you could get the screen bright enough to use on a sunny day outside.
customer_reviews.author: JasonDB

customer_reviews.title: Mastercam itself runs pretty good. I have also tested out some games ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the new version with the 8th gen i5-8250u. I am very impressed with this system. I have used it to for my CAD/CAM software. Mastercam itself runs pretty good. I have also tested out some games like tomb raider and max payne 3. This laptop has handled everything I have thrown at it. The screen looks good despite some other reviews. The only thing I knock if for is the use of DDR3 not DDR4 memory. I haven't upgraded anything yet but I plan on going to 16gb ram soon. My CPU also runs over 3ghz most of the time with no heating issues either.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: (Still) Happy with this laptop
customer_reviews.text: Working great right out of the box! It is fast, no screen issues, no keyboard issues. I also tested a DVD and although it's not totally silent it's also not noisy and distracting and my DVD played perfectly after a software update. This is not a super thin or light laptop (as many are nowadays) for carrying around, but it’s portable enough for me and I’m a petite person. Update 6 months later: Still loving it and no complaints. It boots up instantly (SSD), very fast. Works well. Clear video and good audio for listening music. I have recommended it to others already.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: A nice laptop.
customer_reviews.text: This is really a nice laptop. It boots fast, the screen is plenty bright for me, & battery life measures in days as I use it about 2-3 hours a day. Initially the screen would go blank and not come back without poking a paper clip in a hole on the bottom to "disconnect the battery", but that problem went away after a Windows update. In fact, the only problems encountered were Windows 10 problems. I would have preferred Windows 10 Pro instead of Home. It replaces my 12 year old Lenovo with an almost full hard drive and not enough RAM.
customer_reviews.author: C. Niday

customer_reviews.title: I think I've found a keeper.
customer_reviews.text: lightweight with lots of power I bought this mainly for writing. Boots up in like 4 seconds. Loads Microsoft word in 3 seconds. Doesn't solve the freezing up thing during auto save. I guess it wasn't my old laptop issues. This is a Microsoft issue. I have gone 12 hours without charging. (No wifi or gaming. Just editing) Pros-light. Huge screen. Lot's of options. plenty of power. 16 hour battery life (In battery saver mode) Not a lot of bloat ware. decent speakers. Plenty of USB ports. Cons-Windows 10. Battery life meter inconsistent. Comes with Norton antivirus. Just gets in the way. Sept 2020: UPDATE-LCD monitor failed. Cost me 70 bucks to replace. Still working great besides that
customer_reviews.author: F. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage- lasted less than 1 1/2 years
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in January 2018 and only used it for internet and emails, no gaming. It died a week ago. Took it to a computer technician to repair the problem without success. The computer will not boot up, no screen, comes on and turns itself off after less than 2 minutes. Tech tried everything.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Lover

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!!
customer_reviews.text: This computer has been a pain shortly after we purchased it. After owning it just a couple of months, it slowed down. I scanned for viruses, malware, etc. but didn’t find anything. Then it got worse. It would just go black and/or freeze and the only thing that worked was holding down the power button. After a couple more months, I decided to wipe it out and restore it to factory settings. Finally it ran again! But less than a month later, it was slow and freezing again. I’ve had it less than a year and I’ve restored to factory settings twice! I am ready to throw it in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Lot of performance for the dollar
customer_reviews.text: This laptop has great performance, even under a serious load, rendering a video, downloading an update for a game and playing fortnite, it never had lag spikes or hiccups. The screen res is fine at 1080, however the color saturation is not the best but at this price you can't complain much. Also, the battery on it is not the best, even just watching Netflix on it, seems to only last 2 or 3 hours. So you definitely will want to bring the charger with you. But this laptop is a work horse!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: How is this allowed
customer_reviews.text: How is it that Acer is allowed to sell faulty products and not provide meaningful support? This laptop does not "sleep" correctly, and hasn't from Day 1. The screen goes dark but will not awaken. The computer appears to be on, but the screen is completely dark. You have to power off and on a few times to get the screen active again. It is clearly Acer's fault (and no, sweetie, I didn't spill anything on the keyboard, but nice try.) But they do not provide actual solutions.
customer_reviews.author: Buckingham

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected
customer_reviews.text: This computer performs as expected. There are a couple of issues I have with this computer. First, the back light for the keyboard turns off after 30 seconds. In addition, the num lock is flaky sometimes on and sometimes off. Since there is a numeric keypad, I would rather it remaining on. The good things is the m.2 drive, and a space for a 2.5" drive which I have an SSD to hold all of my personal files.
customer_reviews.author: Frank S. Pilone

customer_reviews.title: Runs great. Just be sure to save your work and turn it off, don't let it sleep.
customer_reviews.text: I am a data analytics students and this computer is fast. I really enjoy it for the things I use it for. My only complaint is that if I just lock my computer for the night instead of turning it off, the monitor often won't turn back on when I wake it up. The power light will change to show that it is on but the monitor stays dark even after I toggle the monitor brightness. I end up having to crash the power. So when it's on it works great, just be sure to save and turn it off if you don't want to lose your work.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performer w/ contemporary hardware
customer_reviews.text: Basic laptop...except this one has a I-5 quad processor, discrete 2GB Video, 256GB SSD Drive, HD-HDMI and costs about $200 more than the "Amazon Choice". I was torn, but opted for the updated tech. This computer HATED that I added Google Apps. Rapid Boot up. Good Screen. I'm using an outboard keyboard and mouse...but I also liked the on-board input devices (lit keyboard). I deleted all of the Norton bloatware (and a few others) and turned on Windows Defender. No issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Elliot

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, Cheap Hardware
customer_reviews.text: I received this Laptop damaged. The speed was admirable, while it lasted. The hardware is cheaply made, and not worth the purchase price. Also, after a week of use, the screen started blanking out with weird static-type problems. I returned this product after a week... There were just too many unforeseen problems with this product, for me personally. I was VERY Disappointed with my purchase. I have yet to receive a refund from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Nice while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: Bought on 10/5/19. Understood Acer's warranty is for one year. Last night, 9/18/19, the screen pixelated, computer shut down, and it will not start (apart from keyboard lights turning on and off). Called support today, who told me that my computer is out of warranty on, conveniently enough for them but patently false, today, 9/19/19. Don't buy Acer if you want it to last more than a year, and if you want honest customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Greta C

customer_reviews.title: Yes - This One!
customer_reviews.text: This is easily one of the best price-to-performance models. Acer is not the crap is was 10 years ago. I actually like their laptops better than ASUS now. If your budget is in the $600 range, get it. The 4-year accidental protection for another C note was a no-brainer. You can upgrade the RAM and SSD later. Speed, graphics and battery are great for the price. Construction feels nice and solid. Backlit keyboard with num pad is a big plus. The screen won't blow you away, but there's nothing wrong with it. By the way, it is NOT a touch screen...no idea why the rating system was asking about it.
customer_reviews.author: Crosscheck67

customer_reviews.title: Good computer but very heavy
customer_reviews.text: The laptop is ok but a few things I was a bit disappointed in. One, it is very heavy. This is not a laptop you want to take around a with you. Two, I don't like the keyboard. The placement of the keys is not great and it's a rather cheap feel to them. I'm slowly getting used to the setup but I miss my old Lenovo. Oh well. For the good things: the speed is great and the display is fine. Screen is good size and very bright. Please know that I'm only using it right now for very basic tasks - nothing heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Debs

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday use laptop!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop has proven to be a fantastic investment for me! Now I'm not a gamer or a "power user," I just need something I can use for everyday tasks as well as for college. The SSD is fast and it has more than enough storage for my needs. Only one complaint: I wish I knew a way to turn num lock on by default. Every time the computer gets turned off or put into sleep mode, it resets, so you have to manually turn num lock back on. Other than that, no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working great, very fast, good cooling
customer_reviews.text: Working great. This is my first solid state comp and I could not be more happy. SSD is so much faster. I can run low demanding games on here with max graphics flawlessly, like WoW or LoL. The fans are relatively quiet for Acer (my last Acer sounded like a jet). If this had a touchscreen it would be perfect, but the battery life is better since it doesn’t, so it’s a trade off.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McKernan

customer_reviews.title: Died on day 366!
customer_reviews.text: On the 366th day the laptop stopped taking a charge. Zero support from Acer at this point - so my husband replaced the AC adapter and then the battery to no avail. He also ran through a reset procedure that did not help. He may try replacing the power port but this kind of failure seems ridiculous for a year old laptop. Won’t be buying another Acer.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Gaynor

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this Laptop for the price believe I tried before purchasing. I am a student and I mostly write my essays and other school related stuff on it. But also I love minecraft and this easily gets above 100 FPS with mods. I've add a 1TB Seagate harddrive and an additional 8 Gb of RAM and it was very easy to do. I also play some shooters but I keep the setting on Low and I get a solid 60 FPS. Anyways it's great laptop for all round use especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: thahovster7

customer_reviews.title: DON BUY LOCKS UP ON START UP.....CAN'T DO ANYTHING
customer_reviews.text: Brand new. Bought 5/5 for 853.00.... THE PROBLEMIS IT LOCKS UP ON START UP......I CAN'T DO ANY THINK. PASS MY 30 DAY WINDOW OF RETURN. NEVER SEEN ANYTHING THIS BAD BEFORE ON A COMPUTER........DON'T BUY........
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: A $400 Lenovo Will Stream Just as Well
customer_reviews.text: I use a laptop as a "tuner" on my 55" flat panel TV with remote mouse & keyboard. I watch stuff on You Tube and other free sites with old TV shows. The rest is just stuff that any laptop will do (reading e mails, etc). So, I can't talk about gaming (it plays Scrabble and Solitaire just fine). But so does the $400 Lenovo. It is as sturdy as any other laptop they sell these days. It is a tad slower at times than my 6 year old Toshiba (which cost $650 at the time. Any shortcomings in either of these computers is attributable to Windows 10. Nothing more. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: OlderWiserReader

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed With This Acer Aspire E 15 Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I am not a happy camper. I did a lot of research before deciding to buy this particular Acer Aspire E 15 laptop. After owning this laptop for only 13 months, it died. DEAD. The motheboard failed: I find this to be completely unacceptable. I used this laptop to check e-mails and browse the web on occasion (i.e., no gaming or social media). The cost to repair and replace the motherboard is not worth it. I am going to have to buy a new one. It will definitely NOT be an Acer. My husband's old Dell laptop is still going strong at 7 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice computer
customer_reviews.text: So I waited a couple weeks before reviewing this to make sure I liked it. I am not a computer person but it works great for my small business. Super fast at start up LOVE the lit up keyboard, memory is plenty and no issues so far. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SR1997

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great laptop for the price. There is room to add another hard drive and bump up the memory when ready. It is super fast and only needed a little de-cluttering i.e. removing unwanted or trial programs out of the box. I had it set up and connected to my network in no time. Performance for web and applications is much faster than I expected. I haven't tried any games on it except for my fiance is playing SIMs 3 and she loves it :)
customer_reviews.author: cappyra

customer_reviews.title: Perfect keyboard layout
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard layout on this thing, sort of a dense full size with 10 key, should be the standard for laptops. The battery lasts just over one million hours, I assume, because it lasts far longer than I am willing to work in a day. It also has the fancy new touchpad that lets you do all the snazzy gesture stuff, 3 finger alt-tabbing and 2 finger scrolling and all that jazz. I wish it had more control for how the keyboard lights up, adjustable delay and whatnot. Maybe it does, I couldn't figure it out in 10 seconds so I decided it was not adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop for virtualization
customer_reviews.text: Having just received the laptop, I can not give a full review. It runs great, however, so I have no complaints. I would like to clear one thing up I have seen in the reviews (possibly from older models): this machine does virtualization just fine. Vt-x is enabled by default and can be enabled/disabled in the BIOS. I do all of my work in virtual machines and have no issues running virtualbox. I dedicate 4 cores/4 GB of RAM to a VM and still easily utilize Windows, Chrome, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tim W

customer_reviews.title: This is great computer
customer_reviews.text: I stumbled across this laptop by accident, and I am happy that I did. This laptop has some great specs for a great price, and it runs linux very well. Everything works just fine with linux running on it, and I am getting good battery life from it. I did upgrade the ram to 16gb and I am going to install a second hard drive as well. I was going to buy a Thinkpad, but for price and specs I took a chance with this laptop. I am very happy that I did, and I would recommend getting this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: The Workhorse I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: My old Thinkpad finally died. This laptop is not lightweight, small or sexy, but it is exactly what I needed as an everyday, personal laptop. The large screen's resolution is great; it has a 12 hour batter life; and as a old timer, it is pretty cool to have the separate numeric keypad on the right, a CD drive and serial ports.
customer_reviews.author: Julia R Washington

customer_reviews.title: Nice computer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my Granddaughter and she really likes it. She had just gotten a promotion and needed a laptop. She states the screen is very nice and the computer runs fast. I got it with Office 365 installed, and then also bought the subscription for 365 and we were going to family share that part, but that all went haywire. I have been charged, have not been able to share, and she has been charged as well. Not sure what happened and am still trying to work it out. Other than that, the computer does everything well.
customer_reviews.author: TwinrocksTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Updating Machine
customer_reviews.text: I call this my updating machine. I don't use it much I only get it out when I'm camping or traveling for a bit of work or watching a DVD. Inevitably whenever I open it up it insists on updates and takes about 6 hours to do so. I don't even know why I own it I swear smashing this machine would make me feel better about my life. I know it's not entirely laptops fault some of it is Windows but the way this thing is configured is a total disaster. I literally couldn't be more mad at it.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Sand

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, dependable laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop. I've had it a few months now and it has had no issues, big or small and is great for streaming movies (just so long as you have fast internet service). I mainly use it to connect to my large screen TV's. Acer appears to be a good brand as did my other laptop (gave to a friend in need) an Asus. I once swore by HP but their products seems to be less dependable and cost effective than they once were.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Shopper 62

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great battery life
customer_reviews.text: I'm a game developer, I use this laptop to program games in Unity, it works pretty well though having just a Geforce MX150 with 2GB of VRAM might not be recommended for high poly games. I don't play games other than Guitar Smith 2014, and the laptop works great for the that. While game developing off the plug, the battery has lasted about 5-6 hours with monitor brightness turned all the way up. I haven't tested the webcam. This computer is a really good value, this is about the lowest price you can find with a discrete graphics card. The Geforce MX150 has slightly better performance ~ 3% better than the GTX 950M.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L. Frazier

customer_reviews.title: number lock
customer_reviews.text: I like this computer and would buy again. lowered rating to a 4, as there is no way to tell if the number lock is on or off without pressing the numlock key; can be very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: working
customer_reviews.text: Hello, UPDATE: Its working after sending it to acer for fix. I Bought it last Nov.25,18 now its not working, and I’m stuck without laptop while I’m on my vacation here in other country, I’m the only one using it and use it carefully and it suddenly won’t turn on but a tiny light on the keyboard when I press the turn on button. All my files and vacation videos are in my laptop, I’m afraid I can’t recover it. I am disappointed. And I won’t be back till next month.
customer_reviews.author: JVLapla

customer_reviews.title: Meets my needs and expectations
customer_reviews.text: I bought this computer for home use. I do some work at home as well. This computer came in excellent condition. Booted right up with no issues. Very fast internet use. Not bogging down like my old one. I5, 256 SSD and 8GB was what I minimally wanted and found it in this unit at a very good price. Saw reviews that questioned screen quality but mine is perfect. I added Microsoft Office and Norton. It did come with 30 day Norton trial. I have no complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Todd H.

customer_reviews.title: Beginner to Mid-level audio workstation
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop to do home recording for music. I protect it by barely getting online with it, and keeping only a handful of necessary applications on it (Running Reaper DAW, Lightoom video software, and Spotify app. So I can only speak to its very focused usage. But it is processing large audio files very efficiently, opening the apps quickly. Very quick startup and shutdown. Beautiful screen color. Good looking keyboard. For the price (other audio workstations usually run $1200 plus), this is helping me meet my needs at a budget friendly level.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: This laptop is a gamble
customer_reviews.text: It's a great laptop...when it works. I bought this as a gift for a friend and it worked for about a month before it stopped turning on for no reason (apparently a common problem with Acer products) so she sent it in to have it fixed. It came back and worked for a couple more months, and it has stopped working AGAIN. Now I have to figure out if it's possible to still get a refund on this thing. Way to ruin Christmas, Acer.
customer_reviews.author: Winter Cross

customer_reviews.title: Fast, powerful, built strong
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what computer some of these reviewers got, but this deal is unbelievable. To get the features like this good luck. Not only that most all reviews from Tech, magazines, etc have all said same. Its so fast just click and 1 to 2 seconds it shuffles through youtube, videos, web pages, any thing. Photoshop, wow! Now, to get this config you would have to build it yourself. People said it wasn't bright enough but I run at 50 to 75 percent and its white bright. I'm not naive to laptops, I've owned many over the years. Acer seems to be the only one who puts together stuff like this.
customer_reviews.author: reed savvy

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I am a techie and thought this was a good value for my father. Unfortunately, it died after about 10 months. So we sent if off to warranty repair (at our expense) and it came back a month later working again. Roughly 10 months after that it died again :/ This time we are out of the warranty period so tough luck for us I guess. I will not be buying Acer again. We'll see if we can get my dad to give apple a try since my wife's MacBook hasn't had any issues in 6 years. I thought I wasn't being too cheap with this one. I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Very fast but keeps shutting off
customer_reviews.text: I've had my laptop for about 9 months. It is very fast which I appreciate. But it has recently started shutting off on a regular basis with no warning. The laptop won't turn back on unless you unplug it and stick a tiny needle in the bottom, which is a workaround they designed to account for this issue. While this trick works, it's still very frustrating to do this on a regular basis. I'm within the 1 year warranty so I will have to look into it but I will have to pay for shipping which doesn't seem very fair.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: it does it's job
customer_reviews.text: I get about 4 hours of sims 3 about it plays games I like well unless you need more space this will work for most people
customer_reviews.author: wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Decent work/gaming laptop combo
customer_reviews.text: Depending on your primary need for a laptop, your mileage may vary. From what I've noticed, this unit seems best suited for work and casual use. For apps like the Adobe suite, there's moderate performance to be expected, with slight slowdowns in Photoshop and Lightroom rendering. In terms of gaming, don't expect any hardcore performance out of this device. It's best suited for casual-to-moderate gaming, with fps averaging at 90-140. As a whole it's a great buy for the price, but for anything higher-level look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Godinez
